page.title: 10FAMOUS PEOPLE
page.content: The Rev. James Fielding became Vicar of Haslemere in 1786. He lived for a time at Chase Farm. Parson Fielding, as he was known, was a notorious highwayman, robbing coaches on the Portsmouth Road (now the A3). At Chase Farm a brass plate of a mailbag was later found, which proved he was never convicted. James Mangles the diarist lived at Valewood House in 1850 .In his diary he kept a record of his conversations with the poet Alfred Lord Tennyson. This diary was lost for some years but rediscovered in the laundry room at Valewood House in 1970. Helen Allingham, the 19th century water colour artist, lived and painted in this area. Among her pictures was one of Fleur de Lys cottage next to Jesse Mann's Do-it-Yourself shop.
